reviews.text: We were looking forward to staying at the Sonnenbichl for five nightd during our recent trip in Europe, and using Mittenwald as our base of operations for exploring southern Bavaria and the Tyrol. In the main, even though we saw little of the hotel as we were up early and returned late, we were quite pleased by our experience there. The owners speak little English, but are very friendly (indeed, the place seems to cater to a German clentele more than an international one, from what we could tell.) The rooms are ample in size, quite basic, but extremely clean and well-maintained. There is no air conditioning, but you can open the windows and the bracing mountain air provides plenty of exhilaration. The breakfast room is lovely, and we had a wonderful table by the window, overlooking Mittenwald, every morning. There is also a very nice outside deck where you can breakfast as well (but it rained nearly every morning we were there, so there were few takers for the deck, alas). The breakfast itself is a standard German adffair, with all the usual suspects-- boiled eggs, wonderful dark bread and rolls, various cheeses & cold cuts, a limited selection of fruit (I would have liked a toaster, too). So, all in all, I have no complaints about our stay. The only thing that rubbed me the wrong way took place about a month before our arrival, when I asked if it might be possible to stay only four nights instead of five. The owner informed me that, if we did so, we would still need to pay 80% of the rate for the cancelled night-- this a MONTH before our arrival. That didn't seem too accomodating to me. But our stay at the Sonnenbichl was fine, and the price was reasonable. (I wish we had put aside more time to explore Mittenwald, though, as it seems a wonderful and charming town.)
reviews.title: Nice, Friendly Guest House in a Charming Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had noticed the great setting of this hotel on a previous trip to Mittenwald and were not disappointed. The room was comfortable, the balcony had fantastic views. The managers f were friendly, as were the other guests. The breakfast provided a good start to a day of walking. The hotel is close enough to the centre of the town for a wide variety of dinner possibilities, concerts etc. We will come back if we can.
reviews.title: Comfortable and friendly 'Gaestehaus' in amazing surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bavarian trip with wife. Stayed at the Landhaus (AKA Gastehaus) Sonnenbichl for eight days straight. Bottom line up front: decent lodging but nothing to write home about, and owners make up charges as they go and charge your card after your gone.
reviews.title: Ad hoc charges...avoid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't speak a lot of German and the owners--who live on site and directly handle all affairs--don't speak a lot of English. Cold breakfast is served daily from 8:00 to 10:00. I didn't know breakfast wasn't included in the price, and the owners were so put out our first morning when we went to have breakfast in town, I falsely assumed it must have been. Shame on me. However, when the owners charged my credit card for a breakfast we didn't have because we didn't expressly decline breakfast the day before, and gave as a reason after the fact "because we can," then shame on them.
reviews.title: A view worth every Euro!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't want to sound like I'm complaining, and I normally leave above-market-rate reviews, but I was also a bit put out that I was charged for a night I didn't even stay there. My wife and I decided to take an overnight trip to Salzburg, Austria (beautiful city; well worth the drive; stay at the Sheraton), and had let the owners know in advance that I wanted to check out for one night so as not to pay for two hotel rooms. They claimed I didn't give enough advance notice (they didn't say how much was required...apparently 24 hours isn't enough) and I ended up paying for an empty room. I was also charged for internet when one of the housekeeping staff, who gave me the login info--assured me it was free. Sauna also cost extra to use, I think 12 Euros per day.
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning views!!
